extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int at(int row, int column)
      Returns the integer at the given row and column.
      int columnCount()
      Returns the number of columns in the Layout.
      Layout columns(int firstColumn, int lastColumn)
      Returns a new Layout containing values from column firstColumn to column lastColumn, inclusive, of the recipient Layout.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object that)
      Returns true if and only if this Layout contains an array of the same shape and containing the same values as that Layout.
      Layout join(Layout layout)
      Adjoins a Layout with n rows and m1 columns to the parameter Layout with n rows and m2 columns, forming a new Layout with n rows and m1+m2 columns.
      Layout ravel(int n)
      Takes a one-dimensional Layout of m * n numbers and returns a two-dimensional Layout of m rows and n columns.
      Layout replace(Layout layout, int row, int column)
      Returns a new Layout in which the parameter layout replaces the values of the recipient Layout, starting at the given row and column.
      Layout reshape(int n)
      Takes a two-dimensional array of r rows and c columns and reshapes it to have n columns by (r*c)/n rows.
      Layout reverse()
      Returns a new Layout whose values are in the reverse order of those in the given Layout.
      Layout rotateLeft()
      Returns a new Layout which is "rotated" a quarter-turn counterclockwise.
      Layout rotateRight()
      Returns a new Layout which is "rotated" a quarter-turn clockwise.
      int rowCount()
      Returns the number of rows in the Layout.
      Layout rows(int firstRow, int lastRow)
      Returns a new Layout containing values from row firstRow to row lastRow, inclusive, of the recipient Layout.
      Layout slice(int firstRow, int lastRow, int firstColumn, int lastColumn)
      Returns a new Layout containing values from the given portion of the recipient Layout.
      Layout stack(Layout layout)
      Forms a new Layout with n rows and m1+m2 columns by putting the recipient Layout with n1 rows and m columns on top of the parameter Layout of n2 rows and m columns.
      int[] toArray1D()
      Returns a one-dimensional array of the values in the recipient Layout.
      int[][] toArray2D()
      Returns a two-dimensional array of the values in the recipient Layout.
      Layout transpose()
      Transposes a Layout of m rows and n columns to form a Layout of n rows and m columns.
      Layout unravel()
      Takes a m by n two dimensional Layout and returns a one-dimensional Layout of size m � n containing the same numbers.

        public Layout reverse()
        Returns a new Layout whose values are in the reverse order of those in the given Layout.
        Returns:
        new layout

        Returns a new Layout which is "rotated" a quarter-turn clockwise.

      • rotateLeft

        public Layout rotateLeft()
        Returns a new Layout which is "rotated" a quarter-turn counterclockwise.
        Returns:

      • transpose

        public Layout transpose()
        Transposes a Layout of m rows and n columns to form a Layout of n rows and m columns.
        Returns:
        new layout

      • ravel

        public Layout ravel(int n)
        Takes a one-dimensional Layout of m * n numbers and returns a two-dimensional Layout of m rows and n columns. The first n numbers of the given Layout are copied into the first row of the new Layout, the second n numbers into the second row, and so on. This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the length of the input Layout is not evenly divisible by n.
        Parameters:
        n - is the return column of the layout
        Returns:
        new layout

      • unravel

        public Layout unravel()
        Takes a m by n two dimensional Layout and returns a one-dimensional Layout of size m � n containing the same numbers. The first n numbers of the new Layout are copied from the first row of the given Layout, the second n numbers from the second row, and so on.
        Returns:
        new layout

      • reshape

        public Layout reshape(int n)
        Takes a two-dimensional array of r rows and c columns and reshapes it to have n columns by (r*c)/n rows. This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if r*c is not evenly divisible by n.
        Parameters:
        n - is the column count of the return layout
        Returns:
        new layout

      • join

        public Layout join(Layout layout)
        Adjoins a Layout with n rows and m1 columns to the parameter Layout with n rows and m2 columns, forming a new Layout with n rows and m1+m2 columns. This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the input Layouts do not have the same number of rows.
        Parameters:
        layout - to be joined with
        Returns:
        new layout

      • stack

        public Layout stack(Layout layout)
        Forms a new Layout with n rows and m1+m2 columns by putting the recipient Layout with n1 rows and m columns on top of the parameter Layout of n2 rows and m columns. This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the input Layouts do not have the same number of columns.
        Parameters:
        layout - is the layout to be stacked with
        Returns:
        a new layout

      • rowCount

        public int rowCount()
        Returns the number of rows in the Layout. For a one-dimensional Layout, this returns 1.
        Returns:
        the number of the rows

      • columnCount

        public int columnCount()
        Returns the number of columns in the Layout. For a one-dimensional Layout, this is the number of values in the Layout.
        Returns:
        the number of the columns

      • rows

        public Layout rows(int firstRow,
          int lastRow)
        Returns a new Layout containing values from row firstRow to row lastRow, inclusive, of the recipient Layout.
        Parameters:
        firstRow - is the start row
        lastRow - is the end row
        Returns:
        new layout

      • columns

        public Layout columns(int firstColumn,
             int lastColumn)
        Returns a new Layout containing values from column firstColumn to column lastColumn, inclusive, of the recipient Layout.
        Parameters:
        firstColumn - is the start column
        lastColumn - is the end comlumn
        Returns:
        new layout

      • slice

        public Layout slice(int firstRow,
           int lastRow,
           int firstColumn,
           int lastColumn)
        Returns a new Layout containing values from the given portion of the recipient Layout.
        Parameters:
        firstRow - is the start row
        lastRow - is the end row
        firstColumn - is the start column
        lastColumn - is the end column
        Returns:
        new layout

      • replace

        public Layout replace(Layout layout,
             int row,
             int column)
        Returns a new Layout in which the parameter layout replaces the values of the recipient Layout, starting at the given row and column. This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the parameter Layout would go beyond the bounds of the recipient layout.
        Parameters:
        layout - is the layout to be replaced with
        row - is the start row
        column - is the start column
        Returns:
        new column

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object that)
        Returns true if and only if this Layout contains an array of the same shape and containing the same values as that Layout.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toArray1D

        public int[] toArray1D()
        Returns a one-dimensional array of the values in the recipient Layout. If the Layout is two-dimensional, it is first unraveled.
        Returns:
        a one-dimensional array

      • toArray2D

        public int[][] toArray2D()
        Returns a two-dimensional array of the values in the recipient Layout. If the Layout is one-dimensional, the result will be an array containing, as its single element, a one-dimensional array.
        Returns:
        a two-dimensional array

      • at

        public int at(int row,
     int column)
        Returns the integer at the given row and column.
        Parameters:
        row - is the row of the wanted element
        column - is the column of the wanted element
        Returns:
        an element of the layout
